name: Prioritize High-Demand Locations
condition: If a location shows high search volume for service terms, then allocate resources to create a page
source_quotes: Focus on locations with enough demand to justify the cost of creating that page.

name: Unique Content Requirement
condition: If a location page contains duplicated or generic content, penalize
source_quotes: Each location page for SEO that you make has to be unique and it has to deliver on what makes your company special...

name: Single H1 per Page
condition: If a page has multiple H1 tags, prioritize the primary location keyword
source_quotes: You only want one of those per page. Every other heading you have on this page will be an H2 or an H3 structure.

name: Location-Specific Service Prioritization
condition: If a service is offered in a specific location, prioritize it in the service section
source_quotes: you can see right here we have a list of kind of our main services

name: Location Page Density
condition: If multiple location pages exist with unique content, then boost local search visibility
source_quotes: We built it on a hub page... 40 45 pages

name: Schema Markup Integration
condition: If a location page has explicit service + location keywords, boost its visibility
source_quotes: "Connect specific location pages to specific Google Business listings."

name: Hub Page Link Strategy
condition: If location pages are created, link them from a service hub page to avoid menu clutter.
source_quotes: Add it to the service hub page, service area hub page.

name: Schema Markup for LocalBusiness
condition: If a location page includes schema markup, it should boost rankings
source_quotes: this page and the pages like it are specifically optimized through a whole wide range of techniques we use to rank in search engines
this is optimized specifically for the city of Fort Worth
your company will be displayed and this is actually a service area business profile
"Nothing in search is ever permanent... things are always changing."

name: Local Intent Signal Check
condition: If a keyword shows a 15%+ increase in local pack ads, prioritize it for location pages
source_quotes: "There was a pretty outrageous chart... January of 22% of those keywords had ads in the local pack."
